results.title: Adjunctive metformin for antipsychotic-induced hyperprolactinemia: A systematic review.
results.text_hl: In one observational study, 91% of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ no longer had signs or symptoms of @<m>DISEASE_Galactorrhea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005687 @@@galactorrhea@@@. In the RCT, @DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@adverse drug reactions@@@ (@DISEASE_Drug_Related_Side_Effects_and_Adverse_Reactions @DISEASE_MESH:D064420 @@@ADRs@@@) occurred at similar incidence rates among @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and placebo @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@, except that no significant increases in @DISEASE_Nausea @DISEASE_MESH:D009325 @@@nausea@@@, @DISEASE_Sleep_Initiation_and_Maintenance_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D007319 @@@insomnia@@@ and @DISEASE_Psychomotor_Agitation @DISEASE_MESH:D011595 @@@agitation@@@ occurred which were not associated with discontinuations.

citations.NLM: Bo QJ, Wang ZM, Li XB, Ma X, Wang CY, de Leon J. Adjunctive metformin for antipsychotic-induced hyperprolactinemia: A systematic review. Psychiatry Res. 2016 Mar 30;237():257-63. PMID: 26822064
citations.BibTeX: @article{26822064, title={Adjunctive metformin for antipsychotic-induced hyperprolactinemia: A systematic review.}, author={Bo QJ and Wang ZM and Li XB and Ma X and Wang CY and de Leon J}, journal={Psychiatry Res}, volume={237}, pages={257-63}}

results.title: Combination Treatment with Bromocriptine and Metformin in Patients with Bromocriptine-Resistant Prolactinomas: Pilot Study.
results.text_hl: As menstruation resumed and @<m>DISEASE_Galactorrhea</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005687 @@@galactorrhea@@@ resolved, the @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ became pregnant and stopped using @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ but continued taking @CHEMICAL_Bromocriptine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001971 @@@bromocriptine@@@.

citations.NLM: Liu X, Liu Y, Gao J, Feng M, Bao X, Deng K, Yao Y, Wang R. Combination Treatment with Bromocriptine and Metformin in Patients with Bromocriptine-Resistant Prolactinomas: Pilot Study. World Neurosurg. 2018 Jul;115():94-98. PMID: 29530699
citations.BibTeX: @article{29530699, title={Combination Treatment with Bromocriptine and Metformin in Patients with Bromocriptine-Resistant Prolactinomas: Pilot Study.}, author={Liu X and Liu Y and Gao J and Feng M and Bao X and Deng K and Yao Y and Wang R}, journal={World Neurosurg}, volume={115}, pages={94-98}}
